title: Marseille lose to Tottenham, eliminated from all European competitions
description: The Premier League side came from behind to defeat Marseille 2-1 to advance to the knockout round of the Champions League, while sending the French side to last place in Group D.

title: Israel Elections: Exit polls showing Netanyahu with narrow majority
description: Initial projections show the right-wing politician, Israel's longest serving premier, could clinch a narrow majority and make a comeback with the anticipated backing of ultra-Orthodox Jewish and far-right parties.

title: Bolsonaro 'authorizes' transition of power
description: In a speech that lasted just over two minutes, the far-right incumbent neither acknowledged defeat, nor congratulated Lula on his victory.

title: Musk announces $8 monthly charge for verified Twitter accounts
description: Now Twitter users who want the blue tick will have to pay for the service.

title: Algeria in shock after attempted femicide on Ryma Anane, who was doused with gasoline and set on fire
description: The attempted murder of Ryma Anane, who was doused with gasoline and set on fire by her ex-partner, highlights the country's struggle to fight violence against women.

title: From rabble-rouser to boss: Elon Musk's erratic history with Twitter
description: For more than a decade, the founder of Tesla and SpaceX has entertained the social media site with his attempts at manipulation, provocations and bizarre jokes.

title: French tennis star Caroline Garcia wins on the court but loses her coach
description: Bertrand Perret has decided to stop working with the Frenchwoman, who is due to play her first match of the Women's Masters in Texas on Tuesday night against the American Coco Gauff.

title: Bartabas follows the enchanted route of the 'Irish Travelers'
description: Inspired by these nomadic people whose culture is being lost, the French horse legend has created a magnificent show.

title: Twitter's 16 years of chaotic leadership
description: Over the course of a decade and a half of conspiracies and revolutions, the social network has had five changes of CEO, which is an exception in Silicon Valley.

title: Jailed British-Egyptian activist starts 'full hunger strike'
description: Imprisoned dissident Alaa Abdel-Fattah is escalating his hunger strike ahead of COP27, according to his family, who fear for his life.

title: 'While Europe seeks to distance itself from China, Germany seems in favor of business as usual'
description: The German chancellor has given the green light to the sale of a terminal in the port of Hamburg to a Chinese company. An embarrassing decision at a time when Xi Jinping's regime is becoming more hardline.

title: Dida, Kenya's largest female elephant, passes away
description: One of Kenya's last 'tusker' elephants died of old age on Tuesday, as the country suffers from its worst drought in 40 years.

title: Brazil protests grow as Bolsonaro remains silent on election loss
description: Over 200 highways are either fully or partially blocked by protesters as the country waits for the former president to acknowledge defeat.

title: Migos rapper Takeoff dies in Houston shooting
description: The 28-year-old musician was fatally shot at a bowling alley in Houston, Texas.

title: Brazil's Lula will have limited room to maneuver
description: Faced with a divided, mostly right-wing, congress, the president-elect will have to use all his negotiating skills to forge alliances.

title: Italy's Meloni promotes MP once photographed with swastika to government
description: The far-right prime minister Galeazzo Bignami deputy infrastructure minister. In 2005, he had been photographed with a Nazi armband.

title: UK Conservatives suspend MP Matt Hancock over reality TV appearance
description: Matt Hancock, who was health secretary during the coronavirus pandemic, is taking part in the ITV show 'I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!'.

title: The US midterm elections as seen from my French window
description: In his first daily column on the 2022 midterms, Le Monde's former US correspondent Gilles Paris discusses America's craze for redrawing electoral districts.

title: With Paul Pogba injured, Didier Deschamps loses more than just a player for his World Cup squad
description: The French midfielder has been out of action since April, recently suffering from a thigh injury after just returning from a meniscus operation. The team will have to go without another key player at the World Cup in Qatar.

title: Algeria hosts first Arab League summit since Israel normalization deals
description: Arab leaders are meeting in Algiers, but some key figures will be absent, such as Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and Morocco's King Mohammed VI.

title: Why monkeys pick their noses
description: According to a study conducted by an international team, no fewer than 12 species of primates extract their boogers before, well, eating them. Last admitted to the club: the aye-aye long-fingered lemurs.

title: In northern France, Stellantis is betting on hydrogen-powered commercial vehicles
description: To meet the needs of high mileage professionals working in large cities where diesel fuel will eventually be banned, the automotive group is launching the mass production of fuel-cell vehicles.

title: 'At least half of Paris crime is committed by foreigners': Where does Macron's claim come from?
description: The French president stated in a television interview that 'foreigners, either illegal immigrants or waiting for a residence permit' accounted for more than half of the crime in the capital.

title: Unpaid wages top Qatar migrant worker complaints, says UN agency
description: The International Labour Organization reports that almost 35,000 migrants in Qatar complained about their working conditions.

title: South Korea police admit crush response was 'insufficient'
description: Analysts say Saturday's human tragedy in Seoul was avoidable as the technology was in place to predict crowd size and police had received urgent reports of huge crowds.

title: Israel goes to the polls again as Netanyahu attempts comeback
description: The controversial former prime minister is hoping to return to power with these elections that are being held at a time of great unrest and social violence in Israel.

title: Denmark votes with 14 parties contesting for spots in new government
description: The campaign in the Scandinavian country has focused on domestic issues like tax cuts and inflation.

title: Sunak's dithering on COP27 participation causes controversy
description: Criticized after announcing that he would not go to Sharm El-Sheikh for COP27, the new UK prime minister finally announced on Monday that he would make his visit conditional on the progress of the new budget.

title: One year after the Facebook Files: 'When power is highly concentrated, whistleblowers need to be encouraged and protected'
description: In the space of a year, Silicon Valley has been rocked by three whistleblower scandals.

title: Ukraine hit by water and power cuts after Russian missile strikes
description: The Ukrainian army said Monday that Russia had launched 55 cruise missiles and dozens of other munitions at 'civilian targets' across the country. Several blasts were heard in the capital Kyiv.

title: Dance breaks free from traditional Paris stages: 'Audiences are no longer satisfied being spectators'
description: Choreographers in Paris are taking over spaces such as the Louvre museum and the Centquatre cultural space to produce immersive performances.

title: In Tunisia, 'There is a denial of the authorities in the face of the psychological impacts of migration'
description: Psychologist Wael Garnaoui discusses the mental health issues affecting undocumented migrants, from feelings of rejection, to post-traumatic stress, to depression.

title: Giorgia Meloni and fascism's illusory legacy
description: To interpret the new Italian prime minister's rise to power as the return of the Mussolini regime would be to misunderstand its significance.

title: Israeli Prime Minister Yair Lapid hopes to prolong his stay in office
description: The centrist, who is managing current affairs, can remain in power if Benyamin Netanyahu fails to obtain a majority in the November 1 legislative elections.

title: US publishing mega-merger blocked by federal judge
description: A federal judge on Monday blocked publishing giant Penguin Random House from acquiring its competitor Simon & Schuster. The deal would have brought together two of the five largest American publishers.

title: US midterms: The reinvention of Ohio's JD Vance
description: The Republican Senate candidate said in 2016 he would 'hold his nose and vote for Hillary Clinton'. Since then, he has moved closer to former president Trump in his bid to win the Ohio seat.

title: US Supreme Court's right-wing skeptical of using race in college admissions
description: The high court appeared poised on Monday to ban the use of race or ethnicity as a factor in deciding who gets into America's elite universities. This sets the stage for another potential historic reversal like in June, when the right to abortion was overturned.
